effects: Thunderstorms rage within 6 miles of the lair.
Dust devils and sandstorms obscure the land, creating lightly obscured areas that shift unpredictably.
Hidden sinkholes form near the lair; creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot them or fall 1d6 x 10 feet.
Food spoils and water evaporates at twice the normal rate within 6 miles.
A curse of ill fortune plagues intruders; they have disadvantage on saving throws against diseases and curses.
Sandstorms rise suddenly, reducing visibility and dealing 1d4 slashing damage per round to unprotected creatures.

naturalHazards.name: Extreme Heat
naturalHazards.description: When the temperature is at or above 100 degrees Fahrenheit, a creature exposed to the heat without access to water must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the end of each hour or gain one level of exhaustion. The DC is 5 for the first hour and increases by 1 for each additional hour. Creatures wearing medium or heavy armor have disadvantage on the saving throw.

naturalHazards.name: Sandstorm
naturalHazards.description: A sandstorm reduces visibility to 0 within its area, effectively blinding creatures. Unprotected creatures take 1d4 slashing damage at the start of each turn. A sandstorm typically lasts 1d4 hours.

naturalHazards.name: Quicksand
naturalHazards.description: A creature that enters quicksand sinks 1d4 + 1 feet and is Restrained. At the start of each of its turns, the creature sinks 1d4 feet deeper. A creature can escape by using an action to make a DC 10 Strength check, pulling free on a success. A creature completely submerged in quicksand begins suffocating.

naturalHazards.name: Mirages
naturalHazards.description: Mirages can cause creatures to wander off course. When navigating the desert, the navigator must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Survival) check to avoid being deceived by a mirage and losing 1d4 hours of travel time.
